今日もシリウスシュガーはシミュレーター訓練をしていた。\nめるはフラットスピンの:
Sirius Sugaru was doing simulator training again today.
Meguha had special training for Flatspin, and the other four had a one-on-one mock battle.
あっぶなあ！\nもー！ 当たるところだったじゃん！:
That was close!
Geez! You almost hit me!
当てるつもりだからね、当然だよ！\nそらもう一発！:
I'm going to win, of course!
Sora, another shot!
昨日とは対戦相手を変えての模擬戦、なかなか面白いですわね。: The mock battles with different opponents from yesterday are quite interesting.
だんだん七彩の癖がわかってきた。: I was starting to understand Shichika’s habits.
それは、わたくしもです！\nさあ、もう１回ですわ！:
That goes for me too!
Come on, let's do it again!
あ～今日も盛大に墜落してるな～: Ah, it's crashing down again today.
あれは……一体なにをやってるんですの？\nくるくる回って、墜ちてるだけですわ。:
What in the world is that thing doing?
I'm just spinning around and falling.
……あの状態での機体制御、すごく難しいと思う。: ...I think it's really hard to control the aircraft in that state.
シミュレーターで構成された世界に、%usernameusernameuserna: A %usernameusernameuserna% yell echoes through the simulator world.
制御が甘い！ 実戦だったら墜落死だぞ！\n目を閉じるな！ 最後まで機体をコントロ:
You’re under control! If it’s a real battle, you’ll die in the crash!
Don't close your eyes! Control the machine until the end!!
今日も模擬戦を行う。組み合わせはちゆると白奈、七彩とラミ。\nそれから……めるは:
We're having another mock battle today. The combination is Shirona, Shichisai, and Rami.
And then......we'll do flight training.
まーた違う組み合わせ？\nめるはいつになったら合流すんの？:
Another different combination?
When will Meha meet up with you?
まだだ。今、お前たちと戦うのは互いのためにならない。: Not yet. Fighting you right now isn't good for either of us.
うう、すみません～。墜落しないようにしますから～。: Ugh, I'm sorry. I'll make sure it doesn't crash.
墜落しないように操縦するんじゃない。\n自分でコントロールできるようにしろってこ:
Don't steer it so it doesn't crash.
I'm telling you to be able to control it yourself.
――特訓を始めて、１週間が経った。: A week has passed since we started our special training.
んじゃ今日も模擬戦。ちゆ七とラミ白な。: Today's the day of the mock battle. Chiyushichi and Lami-White.
カップリングみたいに言うな！\nてか初日と同じ組み合わせじゃん！:
Don't make it sound like a coupling!
Wait, it's the same combination as the first day!
まあ、その辺はそっちで上手いことやってくれ。\n俺はあっちで、めると飛行訓練して:
Well, do a good job on that front.
I'm doing flight training over there.
確かに、%usernameusernameuserna%さんの訓練の意図はわかり:
Indeed, I understand %usernameusernameuserna%-san's intention in training.
I also feel the effects of that.
このしばらくの特訓で、以前よりもＭＧが体に馴染んで、\n思うように動けるようにな:
Over the past few days of special training, MG’s gotten more used to my body than before
I can move as I please now. But...
ああ、正直見違えたよ。これまではそれっぽくマニュアルどおりなことは\nできていて:
Yeah, to be honest, I didn't recognize you. Up until now, you've been following the manual like that.
Even if I had, I wouldn't have been able to lay the groundwork in the first place.
フォーメーションの精度を高めるためにも、基礎技術の向上は不可欠だ。\n模擬戦もそ:
In order to improve the accuracy of our formations, improving our basic technology is essential.
The mock battles were part of that, though.
チームワークの前に、個人の技術を磨けというのでしょう？\nそれはわかりますが、い:
You want me to hone my skills before we team up, don't you?
I understand that, but I feel sorry for Mr. Meguru!
七彩が指さした先では、\nめるがひとりでシミュレーターを動かしていた。:
Shichika was pointing at...
Meguru was moving the simulator by herself.
もちろん今日も、フラットスピンの訓練だ。\n揚力を失い、機体が錐揉み回転している:
Of course, today was another day of flat-spin training.
It's lost lift, and the aircraft is crumpling and spinning.
……あれは、かなり高度な訓練。それがわかるようになった。: ......that was pretty high-level training. I can understand that now.
でも、ひとつの動きだけを練習しても、実戦じゃ勝てないんじゃない？: But even if you practice just one movement, you can’t win in a real battle, can you?
それに……あなたがめるさんと話しているの、聞こえましてよ？\n足手まといがひとり:
And... I heard you talking to Meguru-san.
One less burden...
はぁー！？ なにそれ！\nめるをイジめて、追い出そうってつもりー！？:
Huh?! What's that?!
Are you trying to tease me and kick me out?!
確かに強くなりたいとは思ってるけど、それはさすがに反対。: I do want to get stronger, but I'm definitely against that.
強くなるのは、５人全員で、ですわ！: All five of us will become stronger!
……それで？ 言いたいことはそれだけか？: ...So? Is that all you want to say?
なっ……！\n誰かをのけものにして強くなったところで――！:
Wha...!?
Just as I'm getting stronger by leaving someone behind――!
やったやったー！ できました！\n%usernameusernameuserna:
Yay, yay! It's done!
%usernameusernameuserna%-san, it's done!!
ちゃんと１００％！\n１００回連続成功させました～！！:
I'm 100% sure!
I succeeded a hundred times in a row!!
ひゃ……１００回連続ぅ～～！？: Hya... A hundred times in a row!?
よくやったぞ、める！\nきっとできると信じていた！:
Well done, Meguru!
I knew I could do it!
ありがとうございますっ！\nえへへ、最後の３回はもう、ドキドキでしたっ！:
Thank you very much!
Ehehe, my heart was already racing the last three times!
ちょちょちょ、ちょっと待った！\nどういうこと、１００回連続って！:
H-H-Hold on!
What do you mean, a hundred times in a row?!
あの高難易度な技を、そんなに……！？\n１回成功させるだけでも相当困難なのに……:
That high-difficulty technique...?!
Just succeeding once would be pretty difficult...!
ああ。これこそがめるの強み……非常に高い集中力が活きたわけだ。: That's right. This is the strength of Meguru's ability to concentrate.
初めから兆候はあったんだ。最初の各種筋トレも\nめるはいつも一番に終わらせていた:
There were signs from the start. The first various types of muscle training.
Meguru was always the first to finish.
集中すれば高いパフォーマンスを出せる。\nだが、今までめるは自らそれを避けている:
If you concentrate, you can put on a high performance.
However, up until now, Meguru had seemed to be avoiding it herself.
私、集中すると、時折周りが見えなくなってしまって……\nそれでドジが多くなっちゃ:
When I concentrate, sometimes I lose sight of my surroundings...
That's why there's a lot of clumsiness...
失敗してみんなに迷惑かけたくない……\nそう思っているうちにそこばかり気にするよ:
I don't want to cause trouble for everyone if I fail...
While I was thinking that, I started to worry about that.
成功しようと思うことと、失敗しないようにと思うこと。\nこれらは一見似ているが、:
To think of success, and not to fail.
These are similar at first glance, but their essence is completely different.
前者は失敗することもあるが、成功だってする。\nでも後者は失敗しない『かも』しれ:
The former can fail, but it can also succeed.
But the latter might not fail, but it would never succeed.
そうか……それが『勝つ気がない』とまで言われてた部分なのね。: I see... So that's the part where they said they had no intention of winning.
そういうことだ。だからまずはめるのマインドを\n切り替える必要があった。:
That's how it is. So first, put the mind into it.
I needed to switch gears.
この子の『集中力』は誰が見ても長所だ。\nでも本人がそう思わないと、何も活かせな:
This girl’s “focus” was one of her strong points, no matter who saw it.
But if she didn't feel that way, she wouldn't be able to make use of anything.
そこで俺は集中力が原因で今まで間違えていたなら、\n今度は同じもので成功体験を重:
So if I had made a mistake up until now because of my concentration...
This time, I wanted to have the same success experience.
ああ。もちろん、フラットスピン自体も実用性があるから、\n身に付けさせた。:
Yeah. Of course, the flatspin itself is also practical, so...
I made her wear it.
『善く戦う者は、人に致して人に致されず』という言葉は知ってるか？: Do you know the saying, 'Those who fight well are not allowed to be let by others'?
お前ら、孫子も知らないのか……まあいいや、\nとにかく主導権を握るのが大事という:
You guys don't know either, Sun Tzu... Well, whatever,
Anyway, it's important to take the initiative.
フラットスピンはその鍵になる……ということですか？: Flatspin is the key to that...?
いかにも。攻防において非常に有用な技術だ。\n積極果敢に敵を攻めていけ、める。:
Indeed. It's a very useful technique for offense and defense.
Go on the offensive with all your might.
んじゃこれで、みーんなの操縦技術がグンと上がったわけだよね！？: Then this means that everyone's piloting skills have improved a lot, right?!
そうだな。となれば、いよいよ次は……: That's right. In that case, next is...
５人揃ってのチームワークの訓練――: All five of us trained in teamwork—
生徒会室に行くぞ！！: Let's go to the student council room!!
